tags: he's got a spy agency like varys can only dream of
summary: Do brans powers even work without weirtree in the south?
question: Do brans powers even work without weirtree in the south?
answer: There are weirwoods in the south, though not as many as there once were. Though there are places that don’t have godswoods, there are definitely enough weirwoods around for Bran to utilize all over Westeros, north or south. Plus, he’ll have his flock of ravens as well.

reblog.comment: There are weirwoods in the south, though not as many as there once were. Though there are places that don’t have godswoods, there are definitely enough weirwoods around for Bran to utilize all over Westeros, north or south. Plus, he’ll have his flock of ravens as well.

tags: the three characters who either get reduced to supporting cast or are given madness to make jaime and dany look better
summary: you can tell that gossip post was fake because it’s meant to mollify dany, braime and jon stans. we’ve already seen the outline...
body: you can tell that gossip post was fake because it’s meant to mollify dany, braime and jon stans. we’ve already seen the outline of s7, the script for s7 and the final outcome and we can tell that some things have been changed but nothing drastic but that gossip post makes claims that are wildly different from what we got and people actually believe it lmao. probably the same people that made fun of sherlock holmes fans for thinking there was a secret episode that could fix series 4

tags: had to edit in case people can't tell i'm being sarcastic
summary: oh yeah grrm definitely planned for all seven kingdoms to separate instead of just the north. it’s why we spent 5 books on a...
body:
oh yeah grrm definitely planned for all seven kingdoms to separate instead of just the north. it’s why we spent 5 books on a civil war between the kingdoms and the aftermath. it’s why one of the big themes of his series is humanity fighting each other instead of uniting to deal with the others. it’s why he made the six kingdoms culturally similar while the north remained isolated for thousands of years

this is definitely not wishful thinking by people who hate bran

blog.description:
charley. in my 20s. they/them.

bisexual. nonbinary. vegan.
activist. spoonie. survivor.

writer. fan. hufflepuff. swiftie.
stark sisters stan. house stark loyalist.

house stark deserved better than GoT.

strength: can start fire by friction.
weakness: can't like things casually.

most recently was teamhousestark.
on tumblr since '08.

multishipper, but mainly
gendrya, femslash, and slash.

credits: sidebar + icon.

summary: lmao one of gendrya’s kids getting bran’s Climb Everything instinct with the addition of Mom Can And Will Give Chase And Drag Me...
question: lmao one of gendrya’s kids getting bran’s Climb Everything instinct with the addition of Mom Can And Will Give Chase And Drag Me By The Ear All The Way To Kings Landing For A Lecture From Uncle Bran
answer:
ok so not exaaaactly this but

[ao3]

It’s the ravens that tip her off to begin with.

Brynden’s always been the most restless of the children, less able to manage it than the ever-focused Shireen, let alone quiet Davos, and Arya barely makes attempts to keep him from running about the castle, though she’s sure that if she made no attempts to constrain him at all he’d run the kingsroad up to his beloved aunt and uncles before Gendry’s concern drove Arya to send the wolves after him. But for all her desire to give him freedom, he reminds her too acutely of Bran on occasion - it was inevitable, really, because she’d rebelliously answered her brother’s order not to name a child after him by naming her boy with Tully looks a name so similar to his - “for their great-uncle” -  but she hadn’t expected all the ways he’d be so intensely like Bran.

Not even how Bran would know them.

She supposes it’s good that he watches out for the children; she knows he does, for there are so often animals around at odd hours, and the larger ones have begun to scatter if she or Gendry or Ser Davos is near. The flock of ravens that doesn’t belong to the castle, though, doesn’t always make note of her, and it’s by the grace of their presence atop one of the godswood’s tall, sprawling trees that she manages to find her wild son dancing about an edge on the top of a tower, his hands and feet clearly skillful in the climb but Arya’s heart in her throat regardless.

One of the wolves comes up behind her, howling momentarily and then speeding in front of her. Winter. One of the grey ones, from the same litter as Sansa’s dear Princess. Of course.

The howl catches Bryden in his movement, making him stand still as though he knows it’s meant to be a warning, and one of the ravens caws a moment later. The flock flies away, and the boy shuffles himself so he’s standing on an actual floor, nervously turning himself to turn around and look down, tossing his red curls out of his face.

She’s entirely certain he sees Catelyn’s glare, though it had been Sansa who had inherited it more than Arya. His voice is loud, but uneven, when he calls out, trying to pretend he’d been perfectly behaved a moment before.

“Good afternoon, Mother!”

tags: bran stark is a good boy clown club
sksksk thats it name now im making it official
summary:
some bran headcanons for the bran is a good boy clown club
- he can actually roll his eyes into the back of his head without...
body:
some bran headcanons for the bran is a good boy clown club

- he can actually roll his eyes into the back of his head without ravening anywhere so like if he wants whoever he’s talking to to go away he’ll just be like ‘I’m going now’, roll his eyes back, and then wait for them to leave

- he can wheel himself around. he has special gloves for pushing the wheels so his hands don’t get dirty

- sometimes. just for the shits and giggles. he’ll go into a bird and sort of fly up to someone. wait for a moment. then steal their food and fly off

- he doesn’t instinctively know how everyone will die (he has to actually look really far into the future and it’s a bit of a hassle) but he pretends he does.

- someone: is rude or annoys him

- bran: haha funny I know the exact date and time and cause of your death try me bitch

- he loves doing that thing where he says something and everyone goes ‘oh did you see that in a vision?’ and then he reveals a letter

- basically what I’m saying is he’s a little shit

- he CAN have children. it’s a little trickier but it DOES work. FIGHT me

- all those memories get confusing sometimes and he can’t tell which are his and which aren’t. sometimes he just needs to sit for a while and sort them out, or have someone gently remind him who he is

- he has nightmares too. there are some pretty horrible memories out there.

- sometimes he likes to check up on his siblings via raven or nearby stray cat or something. they’ll just be minding their own business and a bird with white eyes will just spontaneously land on their shoulder, or a random cat will come up to them and sit at their feet. they’ve learned to just go ‘oh hey bran’, give him a pat, and move on

- he knows every single time when they’re sad. he literally cannot let them be sad or lonely for five fucking minutes he’ll just show up as some random animal and hang out with them until they feel better

- he’s a good boy he’s doing his best

title: Sam is smart and likes researching, and Bran can see the past....
body:
So why don’t they research/past search how the Targeryn’s bound dragons to themselves in the first place?

Sansa would look epic atop Drogon, with Arya on Rhaegal, wolves and dragons. XD

blog.name: theladymeera
blog.title: I'm So Salty I'm a Pickle
blog.description:
Daenerys was my first fave and she will be my last.

Danielle, US. Meera is the frog queen of my heart but I post more about my dragon queen Dany. Trying to be a happy person against the will of all these nihilistic men.

This is my ASOIAF/GOT side blog. My main is a-mountain-girl, my booklr is readingaway.

summary: Please, do rant away! There's so few Bran defenders (and so many ableist anti-bran folks), that reading someone actually be...
question: Please, do rant away! There's so few Bran defenders (and so many ableist anti-bran folks), that reading someone actually be angry about his show and fandom treatment is such a welcome sight
answer:
Ah, I was sort of expecting hate mail lol. There’s not many aspects of that season that I’m not mad about. (Okay it’s basically down to forgesex, Theonsa, Dany getting to smile a bunch in 8x01, Jenny of Oldstones, Ser Brienne, and uh yeah that’s it) Bran being forced to be and then remain an emotionless shell who’s handed the south because he has the ultimate virtue of not wanting anything and then gets called by his depression nickname instead of a more appropriate and positive name ex “The Winged Wolf”, then handing his actual rightful claim to the north to Sansa, ignoring all the political reasons that’s stupid, is like getting a beating. Each thing is a successive slap in the face and that’s not even getting into the number of tired and frankly illogical (and ableist and horrifically sexist) fantasy tropes that came into play in that season. Bran deserved so much better and his being all “zen” and “ruling” the south is not my idea of a happy or “bittersweet” ending. (being a huge sucker for actual bittersweet endings I can tell y’all that there wasn’t an ounce of bittersweet in s8. It was just on a scale from gut-wrenching pointless tragedy, enraging, stupid, illogical, and contrived).

I can’t even get into how much of the fandom treats him from erasing his identity, pretending that magic is his consolation prize for his disability/ that he “couldn’t have become the 3ER without being disabled” (which is horseshit), embracing the show’s treatment of him, often because it gives a certain character a stronger claim to WF, trying to justify the use of that ableist moniker because it was a “shout-out” to the books as if context and sensitivity shouldn’t come into play, especially when he has another moniker that isn’t insulting and several potential names that are positive. Also, a ruler doesn’t have to be given a moniker at the beginning of their reign. Sure Aslan can call the Pevensies “The Magnificent” and “The Valiant” because he’s furry Jesus but irl and ITB monikers usually come after some accomplishment and can change because of events. 

There’s just so much awful stuff out there and a lot of it is directed towards characters that are disabled (Bran mostly but also minor characters like Lollys or Doran) or gender non-conforming (Brienne, Arya, Meera, Ygritte, Asha/Yara, Osha, Loras - because many LGBT+ people don’t conform to gender norms) [sidenote: I’ve seen too many posts from Sansa stans focusing on how each GNC woman, mostly Brienne, Arya, and Meera, should be a guard and that’s a ‘happy’ ending for that woman; we’re ignoring my rant about show!Brienne’s ending], and at characters who break with gender norms but I’m not sure they’d be considered GNC (Dany, Bran again, Edmure - which leads to the examination of how a lot of the hate that’s directed at Edmure, connected to the show’s horrible treatment of him, has to do with his failing to measure up to the violent masculinity that’s expected). It really shows a lot about the biases of fans, of the writers and production crew (not to mention some of the things the actors have said but I don’t take anything they say seriously).

Bran deserved more focus and more screentime especially time in which he was allowed to express himself and have real conversations with people. He’s kind and sensitive and had big dreams that got crushed (friendly reminder that it was Bran whose dream was to be a knight while Arya wanted an administrative role such as king’s councilor) and he’s angry about it and all of that was just brushed over and eventually erased. They even ignored some of the horrible things he did - namely his treatment of Hodor and how at some point canon!Bran is either going to have to look at what he did to Hodor, using and treating him like an animal and learn and redeem himself from that. To D&D Bran wasn’t even a person, he was just erased into a plot information machine that only worked 30% of the time and then they handed him a kingdom because it would “subvert expectations”.

summary: The scene after Jon hushed Sansa in favor of Dany when Jon was ready to follow Dany but Arya stepped in front of him and said...
body: The scene after Jon hushed Sansa in favor of Dany when Jon was ready to follow Dany but Arya stepped in front of him and said that they needed a word and Jon just looked at Sansa and Bran standing nearby. Epic

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
title: Going North
body:
Chapter 1 of my Game of Thrones story is officially done! I have the rest written already and will be updating every other day. Read the first chapter here.

Summary:

Bran falls and wakes with visions in his mind, unknowing of a path that will now go untraveled. Together with his brother Jon, he must go north in search of the Raven and the salvation it promises.
